metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12865 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A heap buffer overflow in SANE Backends before 1.0.30 may allow a malicious device connected to the same local network as the victim to execute arbitrary code, aka GHSL-2020-084.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12865` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsane - 1.0.29-0ubuntu5.1
libsane-common - 1.0.29-0ubuntu5.1
libsane1 - 1.0.29-0ubuntu5.1
sane-utils - 1.0.29-0ubuntu5.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sane-backends package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.29-0ubuntu5.1').
